page.title: 03LAND USE - AGRICULTURE
page.content: Delamere/Eddisbury {LAND USE-AGRICULTURE Longley Farm This farm covers about 140 acres & has 130 dairy cows producing a yield of about 5500ltrs per cow p.a.There are potatoes grown here too,& also 20 beef cattle are kept.This farm also used to belong to Parrs Estate & has been farmed by the present farmer & his family for the last 70 years. {longley}means common & was the last piece of land to be enclosed. A ditch runs across the old common & this used to mark the boundary between the parishes of Chester City & Vale Royal.
